title: LTR, No Games, No Gimmicks
text:
SBF, curvy with a few extra pounds, searching for a man to get to know and develop into a relationship. I have HSV (that's "herpes," for those of you too lazy to Google it. You either have it or know what it is and it doesn't trip you out. Am not interested in anyone who casually dates or who is looking for fwb, nsa or anything similar. Married and separated men aren't welcome (your unhappiness in your marriage is not my issue...).

About me...I'm not into pretty words for the sake of pretty words. Come at me like an adult and be real with your intentions to me...or don't come to me at all. You haven't even met me...don't talk about if we were married. You don't even remember how to spell my name...don't tell me you love me. Get to know me and show me you are real about me before you go trying to claim something that isn't yours to claim. I like romance, I like passion. But you need to show me who you are first.

You're between 28 and 42, completely single, nonsmoker, average/stocky/husky/few extra pounds build (prefer average to few extra pounds), funny and fun to be around and give good massages and hugs (I do as well) that don't always lead to you trying to inappropriately cop a feel. You also hate dating as much as I do, want to get married oneday sooner rather than within the next decade, and want children. You're not super serious, but mature enough to deal with rough times as an adult in an adult relationship. You'll know how to (and love making) me laugh, and maybe you have a heart for something greater than yourself. You're a non-smoker...You don't do 420, are not quitting or vaping or looking for the woman to make you quit (that's bullshit, btw). You're single...no 8 month separation or divorce pending or open relationship or gf on a break. You like to cook (Chef Boyardee is not food...), like dogs (but not a crazy pet person), zombie games and action movies are a plus, and good hugs (I'm repeating what's truly important). Me...I cook and bake (sometimes), love dogs, play certain video games, love action movies, word games, all kinds of music, blah blah blah.

I'm getting a lot of responses from frat boy/pretty boy types that I'm not even going to respond to (sorry...). Nothing against frat boys or pretty boys, or guys who describe themselves so openly as "attractive" or "easy on the eyes"...but seriously, did men go around saying this shit 50 years ago, because it just seems so damn weird to me...But seriously now, if you see yourself as being made for the cover of a GQ magazine, and all you have going for you is what you look like and how good (you think) your sex skills are, you're likely as interesting to me as a blonde in a fun house of mirrors and are not who I'm looking for. I don't really want someone who feels the need to brag to me all day, let alone the whole world, of that which they have not even proven...

If your immediate response to my post is something of insult because my words hurt your pride in some way, you're not mature enough (or have enough humor or sarcasm) for my taste.

Am open to men of different races. Am more interested in who you are as a person, but I like what I like as you like what you like when it comes to our preferences. My preferences vary far as what you look like, I won't really know until I know (or until you say something that helps speed that decision along).

Put "Morning Sunshine" in subject line so I know you're real. If you just say hi or just ask me for a pic, you're not my type. Pic for pic, by the way. This is a real post, I saw The Hateful Eight yesterday, and my friend and I are in dispute about its meaning (or, in his opinion, its lack thereof). If you've seen it, I'm curious as to your take on it...unless you have no take, or you're a douche...then I can do without.

title: Looking for a young(ish) disillisoned (or not) OIF/OEF vet
text:
I just can't seem to cross paths with the type of individual I'm looking for. The fact that this person may or may not be modeled on a couple of book characters I've fallen for isn't something I want to think about too much. That seems reasonable for Craigslist.

So I hate admitting my similarities with "most women", but like most women I... 

There isn't even another way to say it, is there?

I like a man in uniform. 

There it is. Gross.

What's even more despicable to me about this... fascination? Attraction? Is that it feels very exploitative in nature. It's not so different than the men on here looking for sex to be provided by the specified body parts and types of certain women. I'm rather disgusted with myself, but I am indeed still typing.

To be clear, I'm not looking to exploit anyone in the sexual sense of the word. Though my fantasy life would not object to the proposition of being seduced by a marine in dress blues... Or camis... Sigh... What I really want is much more cerebral. I would like access to the mind of a man who has experienced life on the brink of death. I want to talk with someone who has seen and experienced loss. I'm looking for an individual who has adjusted (or is still adjusting) to the monotony of living a life almost void of risk when compared with life in the service. I know those experiences are sacred for a lot of folks, so I'm not looking for war stories as much as I am looking for the grit and depth of character that having war stories provides. 

I think friendship and conversation is the ultimate goal here. Maybe the Craigslist man of my dreams will be interested in an email buddy of the contentedly married sort. 

Serial killers and rapists need not apply. I'm sure that's implied, but just so we're on the same page, I am not interested in my corpse being stored in a freezer in your basement... if it's on like a yacht or something fancy, perhaps I can be persuaded.

Forgive any typos. I'm too lazy to proofread at the moment.

title: Re: Anybody meet up with somoneone on here
text:
95% of all the ads from "women" on CL are fake. Most are bots, scammers, spammers, identity thieves or hookers. The identity thieves will ask for your phone number, give you theirs right away in their first reply, or post their number in their ads. They will then take your phone number and try to send malware to your cell phone to steal your identity in order to rip you off. The spammers will send you a "personal" email addy right away in their first reply, or put one in their ad for you to write to. They will then take your email address and send malware, viruses and Trojans to your email account to try to infect your computer, or they will sell your email addy to mass mailers who then flood your inbox with all kinds of advertising. 

Hookers will ask you for money for sex, of course, and the scammers will try and get you to send them money for all kinds of reasons, the most common being plane tickets so they can come to meet you...every single last "woman" from "over seas" is a scammer without exception. If you are stupid enough to send money to someone you don't know over the internet, then you DESERVE to be scammed. It really only takes a little common sense to determine if an ad is real or not...if the response to your reply to an ad doesn't say a single word about anything you wrote to them, it's fake. If an ad insists on you sending picture with "no pic no reply" or something to that effect, just flag it...most of the time it's a scammer looking to steal your pictures to use to scam other people with. It's either that, or you have a shallow, worthless woman who cares only about looks, and if you're not good looking, you're not worth knowing, so you'll be wasting your time...even if you are good looking, as she's a shallow, worthless woman who isn't worth a pint of piss to anyone.

All that being said, my last 3 live-in relationships were with black women (I'm white) I met here on CL...the last one lasted 3 1/2 years, so it CAN be done. You just have to have the patience to wade through all the crap that plagues ALL online dating sites, not just CL. I've found through personal experience that the pay for web sites are even WORSE than CL. At least CL is free.

Happy hunting! :)

Scott

title: Is it supposed to be this hard?

Having gone through a horrible breakup last year the kind that wrecks your world and sends you in to a free fall. I decided to take some time off from dating. I needed to heal, I needed to find my happy place, I needed to find me and what I wanted. I'm finally in a place where I am happy again and the eternal optimistic that I am is hopeful about life and love. I am sure you're wondering "why Craigslist of all places?" title: Lets Share This Life Together
text:
We're all seeking that special person who is right for us. But if you've been through enough relationships, you begin to suspect there's no right person, just different flavors of wrong. Why is this? Because you yourself are wrong in some way, and you seek out partners who are wrong in some complementary way. but it takes a lot of living to grow fully into your own wrongness. and it isn't until you finally run up against your deepest demons, your unsolvable problems the ones that make you truly who you are that we're ready to find a lifelong mate. only then do you finally know what you're looking for. you're looking for the wrong person. but not just any wrong person: the right wrong person someone you lovingly gaze upon and think, "This is the problem i want to have."

I am looking for a long term relationship with a romantic, respectable and wonderful man who is stable and knows what he wants in life and also willing to take risks in a relationship, a man that is not self centered or selfish . I am loving, caring and sincere. Very passionate and loyal. Romantic, nice dinners, walks on the beach. Life is too short to spend it alone.. I am hoping to find a nice guy to enjoy some quality times with.. I don't do or tolerate drugs, heavy drinkers that end up drunk. I don't ever go to clubs or bars I'm not into that scene at all! I love the water,beach, river,lake,I like to camp,fish,anything outdoors really! I absolutely love to cook so hope you love to eat!! I'm kinda old fashioned and believe the woman should take care of the household, always have a meal cooked for my man every night, house cleaned,laundry done etc. And always make sure my partner is happy and full filled in all areas! I have a lot of respect for myself and have morals,never been a girl that sleeps around. Maybe this isn't the right place to find my mr. Forever but maybe ill get lucky and find him, who knows? I'm also looking for my partner to be my best friend,soul mate and lover! I'll send a pic if you send yours! DON'T ask for dirty or nudes I am NOT that kinda girl! So, if your looking for a GOOD woman like me please respond! Also, being honest,genuine,and real is super important because I am all those things!! But you must understand that i am not perfect and neither am i looking for perfection .. I am me and that is all you will get and i expect you to be you as well but with a good heart ..

title: Sonnets
text:
"Whenever I go into a restaurant, I order both a chicken and an egg to see which comes first"


Dear Mr. Right,

As a daydreamer with a vivid and colorful imagination, it was hard for me to put my daydreams of my fairytale man to the side. But I am.

It's hard.

It's hard to truly let go, and let God work. This comes from someone who is a recovering control freak. . .especially when it comes to relationships. I wanted to control every aspect: the meeting, the pursuit, the conversation, and the timing. I was always told that my Mr. Right is somewhere out there. After all, there are plenty of fish in the sea. But I didn't want just a fish. . . I wanted my one true love and I wanted him NOW.

I was impatient. I searched for love and acceptance in all the wrong places. I sought it out in people that continually failed me. I would often see a guy in Starbucks and think, "could he be the one?". . .I mean he did have really nice hair. I did not understand why I was the girl that never had the awesome boyfriend. To be honest Mr. Right, I would pray for you every night. I remember tears running down my face because I so badly wanted to find you. I truthfully wanted that fairytale moment with you, when our eyes met from across the room and we immediately fell in love. I wanted the fireworks and the distant sound of triumphant music and even the cute little floating hearts above our heads, because I thought, "I had found the one made just for me."

title: Read.......then judge
text:
Hi,

So I've recently ended a short term but intense relationship with someone who had very specific desires. While he was adamant that he was not into the BDSM lifestyle, in my opinion there were some definite overlaps. While I was not originally very knowledgeable about, or accepting of, these needs, through this experience I have come to have a change of heart. 

While I am not still hung up on my ex, I will use our relationship to describe what I am looking for in the future:

We had a very intense physical attraction, that I would like to have again. I knew he wanted me because he told me so....repeatedly. It was intense and really nice and significantly helped to improve my self esteem. We also had a pretty deep emotional connection, even though his reluctance to label it as an actual "relationship" led to its downfall,

Moving on:
He naturally took the "lead" in the relationship, and it was nice to surrender to someone who genuinely cared, and was completely devoted, even if that wasn't stated verbally. His feelings were in his touch, which many times were rough and gentle at the same time. He liked to say "good girl" when I did something well, or just pleased him in general. I sort of took pleasure in knowing that I was doing a good job, or that he was very excited because of me. I felt controlled, but also in control....if that makes sense. However, if I was a bad girl I had to be punished....lovingly. Usually this was accomplished by means of a spanking. (hand). Then he would rub me and say that he was sorry but I had to be punished. The tenderness and roughness combined was quite exciting. He liked to call me "princess", and I must admit that I enjoyed being the center of his attention.

My work is extremely stressful and I have spent my (fairly short) life under extreme self control, and have accomplished a lot. It is nice to have a sort of balance brought into my life. At work I am in control and at home I am controlled. I also think that if expressed correctly, it is the most natural way for men and women to interact. 

I was never abused in my relationship and don't look forward to it. I have a very limited sexual experience, due to some not so hidden insecurities and some childhood trauma. However, instead of being turned off by my inexperience he was eager to help and teach me. The relationship did not really include traditional romance, but we spent significant time together in nonsexual settings, He taught me many things, most of which had nothing to do with sex. He was much older, 25 years. However, I enjoyed his consistent attention, and never felt ignored. I am very insecure and tend to need constant reassurance of love and affection, which can be conveyed physically. Control was exercised in the entire relationship, not just the romantic portion, and ideally I would like to experience that again. 

Anyway, I think I have given a brief overview of what I had, and would like to have again. I am not looking for something short term or casual, and don't think that this type of relationship would work under those constraints. It takes time to get to know and trust a man whom you completely surrender to, and the joy of the relationship is the entire dynamic, not just the sex.

My idea of a natural progression would be in this order:

1) Talk extensivly...people are crazy
2) Talk some more 
3) Develop a bond
4) Spend time together,,,,,this is traditionally accomplished by means of more than a few dates
5) Move into romantic territory
6) Talk some more

If any of this resonated with you, Id like to talk. If not......Have a happy Friday

Note* I have been completely honest and vulnerable and expect that in return. Also, if you sound crazy,,,,or lazy, I will not respond*

Please put something to capture my attention in the Subject line of your response

title: Where Are The Real People
text:
Seems to be same o same around here, scrolling through the M4W posts is like eating molded potato chips and drinking a flat Pepsi. Every other post claims to either be the "last honest man," or to "just" be "looking for love" (+ all these other additionals )...Just about every post claims to be a "handsome" or "attractive" male...Never really dawned on me until I started looking at Craigslist...But men who so freely describe themselves as "handsome" and "attractive"...weird me out...for some reason...Maybe there isn't any logic behind that...it just is weird to me (but I'm weird, so could just be a clash of weirdness).

Maybe it's just the whole "putting oneself in a box" concept...maybe that's what has me feeling all funny. Everybody seems to be trying to build a ten-foot round house, in a 4-foot square box...All these claims of wanting love...when all you're after is sex and feel-good feelings. All these claims about being honest...when you're just about saying what you feel in the way that will hurt people the most and get the most attention...All this talk of being a great catch and bragging about this and about that...Why take the car salesman approach (no offense to actual car sales people...just sayin')...I'm not a child, you're not a child...why play the manipulation game to sell me...you...

Where are the real people...Real as in just transparent and sincere in what they say and what they do...and what they want...Where are the people who really want what they say they want...We all have our preferences, me, you and that weird looking guy in the corner (yeah, you)...But where are the real people...

title: Good News, Bad News
text:
The good news? I'm youthful for my age, sane, drama free, cheerful, affectionate and have a quirky sense of humor. I'm independent, practical, rational, successful, sensual, financially sound, and I have a job that I love. I'm self-confident, unpretentious and not even remotely depressed. I'm nice to children and cute furry animals. I get excited about new restaurants, interesting TV shows/movies and good books. I care about certain world issues, and I don't give a hoot about many others. 

The bad news? I don't suffer fools gladly and I don't put up with uncourtious or inconsiderate behavior. I am sometimes stubborn and impatient. I can be too independent (or so I'm told), and though I don't like narcissism or arrogance in a man, I also tend not to do well with those who are insecure and lack self-confidence. I can sustain glamorous for a few hours, but I'm usually more of a Girl-Next-Door type. And for God's sake, of course I'm not "as comfortable in an evening gown as in blue jeans." 

Physically I am tall, average build (not toned but not fat or obese either). I've got blue eyes, long hair and a pretty smile. 

I'm an empty nester WF, divorced, non-smoker, social drinker, who says what she means and does what she says. I am looking for similar characteristics in a local man who is interested in a relationship. I am interested in men of all races, age 46 or older and who live a reasonable distance to me (in rush hour traffic). Extra points if you are interesting, intelligent, attractive and available as defined below: 

Interesting -- Tell me what interests you? Can you pose an interesting question for me in your response that catches my attention? 
Intelligent -- You don't have to have lots of college degrees, but I want a man who communicates well, both verbally and in writing. Now is your chance to show me the latter. 
Attractive -- For me, that means tall (5'10" or taller), average, stocky, or muscular build. Well groomed (bald or shaved head is a plus) and a great smile. 
Available -- No married men or otherwise in a relationship. And - if you have young children in your life, or a demanding or weird scheduled job that limits your ability to have a normal dating (emotional and physical) relationship - pass me by.

Serious replies only please. And yes I am real. I picked Villanova for the winner of my bracket.

title: Uncommon Chef
text:
In my late 40s I finally found the courage to leave my job as a graphic designer and pursue my passion for food. It was part of a long maturing process that also involved creating a healthy distance between myself and my emotionally crippled family. My interest in nutrition soon led to an excitement about cooking and eventually to my becoming a health-oriented personal chef. My individuation from my family and their white-bread-and-mayonnaise values has led to the discovery of myself as a person who is willing to feel deeply, act boldly and think creatively. I want to be with a man who has also become his own person, who considers life an adventure and who has time for romance, intimacy and me.

In my work I help others cook better, host cooking/dinner parties, and cater dinner parties. I'm interested in exploring the science as well as practicing the art of cooking. It would be be great to be with someone who enjoys food and who likes to be the kitchen but I'm capable of being drawn into your world as well if you truly love what you do.

A good match for me is someone who . . ..

...wants to make a difference (big or small scale).
. . .is happy to take the scenic route to just about anywhere
. . .is charmed by down-in-the valley views just as much as bird's-eye vistas.
. . .wants to explore the world --cultures and history-- through food and people, cities and the countryside
....likes to be active, has all-day energy.


Religion has no appeal to me - but I'm definitely intrigued with "spirituality" (am using this for a lack of a better word). Meaning to say, I'm interested in understanding that what's there but cannot be seen.

Community involvement is important to me, I'm active with the South Bay sustainable food movement. Will soon start a two-year term as president of a nonprofit.

Friends? Family? Kids? I have several very close friends, and consider them my family. I raised 4 step children with ex husband in the 90s/early 00s.

Still have my full-suspension mtn bike, panniers, snorkel, backpack, sleeping bag, downhill ski equipment, X-country ski boots, snowshoes. ...and want to do all these activities with a partner,

Eventually, I want to golf, have really enjoyed it the couple of times I've played. And I want to play the piano again, and ride a horse again. I would love to be a good singer and hope to someday take lessons, bonus if I find someone who likes to sing (together). And I love to dance ... the waltz, tango, swing. I'm not one who needs perfection, just enjoyment in a shared activity.

Love yoga, hiking, once or twice a week. I run, occasionally. I like to bike and hope you are ok with me --a slow poke-- some distance behind you. I actually like to fish (shore or boat --jigging, casting, slabbing), I don't have the gear or make a point of going, but will definitely join my partner.

I thoroughly enjoy concerts and live theater; not much of a fan of opera or spectator sports.

I'm exploring and expanding my emotional range with those who are close to me.. It feels like the key to getting the most out of life.

title: Is it supposed to be this difficult?
text:
Another weekend is here and I hope you have something fun planned this weekend. I have with my family like I normally do most weekends, however something was different this time. I miss being a couple. I miss sharing a smile or an inside joke with that special someone. I miss the hand holding and sharing an embrace. Having gone through a horrible breakup last year the kind that wrecks your world and sends you in to a free fall. I decided to take some time off from dating. I needed to heal, I needed to find my happy place, I needed to find me and what I wanted. I'm finally in a place where I am happy again and the eternal optimistic that I am is hopeful about life and love. I am sure you're wondering "why Craigslist of all places?" Well I am not much in to bars or the club scene these days. I work with kids and most everyone in my life is either married or coupled off. Do you ever get tired of being the third wheel?? I am!! I know this is a crazy chance to take but a few years ago I adopted my amazing dog from here and maybe I am hoping that this site well serve me well this time around as well.

I would love to meet someone between the ages of 32 and 42. I know age is just a number to some people but I want to be able to relate to the person I am with. I myself am 34 and have never been married nor do I have any kids. I personally don't care if you have kids or have been married before. As long as you have little or no drama in your life we'll be fine. I am only interested in dating Caucasian males. I hope you understand that this is a preference of mine and not a prejudice. Being that this is CL after all I must stress that I am NOT looking for a friend with benefits or a one night stand. If you send me pictures of your junk I will post it on the male for male section of CL with all your contact information :-)

I hope you take a chance and send me an email. While I am not brave enough to post a picture on here I have tons of them and will happily send you one with my reply. Replies with pictures will get the most preference. It's always nice to see who I'm emailing. Take a chance and let's be brave! We might be completely wrong for each other or completely right. Take a leap of faith with me. The only regrets we have in life are the risks we never took :-)

Most of our clients didn't think online dating was for them before working with us. They said it was too intimidating, too time-consuming, too overwhelming. "It's a numbers game," they said.

Finding a relationship with someone worthy of your heart isn't easy.

You've created a life you love -- a successful career, a sophisticated lifestyle, a grounded sense of self -- but you haven't met anyone worth sharing it with yet. You're at a place in life where your friends have partnered up, and you're left unmatched.

title: How to attract "Good Girls" who want to be BAD...
text:
I want to, but I can't... yet. 

So...

I've been surfing the CE section of CL, and I have to say - some of you have some VERY pretty penises. They make me want to come right over and fuck you blind.

But for whatever reason, I haven't done that yet. And I'm starting to think, the problem is... YOU.

Now obviously, your first thought may be "HEY, I've gotten plenty of action from this. I don't have to change a damn thing." And you're right, you don't have to change at all.

However, from what I've read, the overall response for males is rather low (compared to the number of responses a woman would get if she posted a CE ad for men), and many of the responses you receive are "bots." So maybe you should take heed to this message.

I'm going to help you improve your marketing strategy.

First of all, you need to understand your both your current market AND your untapped market (or, your TOTAL market.) For every woman that's down and has no problem answering your current ad, there has to be at least one or more that has not answered an ad. We're looking, we're appreciating, and we have the desire (wet panties, rubbing one out after the parade of penises on our laptops), yet we can't seem to take that step to contact you. Clearly your current market strategy is not generating new business. You are so focused on retention of current clients that you've neglected to look for ways to drive new business to your market. And increasing your client base is essential to success.

So how do you drive new business? Diversify your marketing.

Most businesses have a combination of marketing tactics - internet, print, tv/radio, etc. Now clearly, I'm not suggesting that you take out print or tv/radio ads to get some ass. This is online, and online it will stay. However, you can diversify your MESSAGE. This way it will reach multiple audiences. Did you even consider that your ONE ad could be multifaceted and appeal to a wide range of women? It can. And let's face it, women are NOTHING if not multifaceted. So, not only would you be appealing to a wider range of women, you would also be appealing to the many sides of each woman. Pause and think about that....
Diversifying your message could (will) lead to a larger market share (more sexual opportunities - to be exact.)

Let me explain how to diversify your message to reach women who want to take the plunge into the wonderful world of CE, but haven't yet.

Sexual - Despite what many believe, women ARE sexual, and you need to appeal to that side of us. You have. The penis pic is great! That's sexual, it's a turn on. It reminds us of what this ad is really about, and trust, if we weren't about that, we wouldn't be perusing CE. And I need the penis pic, because if I'm going to step out, it better be worth my time. :)

But there are some other parts that you have missed. And I've noticed, the prettier the penis, the worse the ad. Sadly, the best ads are from men with no pics. But as I said, I LIKE the penis pic.

Romantic - Many of you are missing this. Your penis pic is accompanied by a raunchy message. Is that necessary? Wasn't the pic of your penis sufficient to convey sexual/raunchy? Why not try to offset the penis pic with some flowery words of prose. I'm not suggesting that you turn this into an LTR ad; casual sex is casual sex. But make us newbies feel a little less shame at the thought of answering such an ad. Instead of "Let me put my rock hard cock into your pussy and blow a 7 day load" (disgusting), why not try, "I haven't had the company of a woman in a while and I would appreciate the opportunity to share a mutually fulfilling sexual experience, NSA." And it's ok to get a little descriptive, but make it the type of descriptive that appeals to WOMEN, not men. text:
It's spring and I want to spend time with a fun loving, affectionate, outdoorsy companion. I go out a lot with friends, but I miss having someone around during the downtime, the quiet moments at and near home that would be so much more pleasant with a partner. Specifically, I like working in my yard- weeding, landscaping and gardening. I've also promised myself to do a porch makeover this spring, but I don't like being alone, so having someone to help (or just keep me company) would be great. I walk my dog in Rock Creek Park most days, care to join me? Finally, I like flat water kayaking on the waterways around DC- my favorite spot is Bladensburg boat house, where you kayak between the Arboretum and the Aquatic Gardens. Sound fun to you? 

So here's the catch- I feel like I've been dating since the dawn of man, and very rarely do I find men who spark my interest (probably my own issue, but I am who I am). I've been in love twice, and hope to find at least one more, where the feeling builds and lasts over time (the most elusive part). And YES, I want to get married someday and live happily ever after with one man. I've had a very exciting life and still do, and I am looking for someone who also has their own fulfilling life, but wants a partner. I have stories to tell, and I want to hear your stories. I want to have interesting, engaging conversation about world issues, the environment, and what you had for dinner last night. The art of conversation is dying, and I am holding on for dear life. Let's TALK. Not text, not IM. 

Please be a native English speaker (or native level), have at least a bachelors degree, and enjoy your job. Why do folks get upset when someone asks what you do? Isn't that how most of us spend the majority of our waking hours? Good or bad, your work probably says a lot about you. 

I'm an extrovert and get along best romantically with other extroverts. I am Jewish and liberal, a winning combination in my book ;-) I'm flexible on religion, not on politics. I'm 41 and presumably you are close (ish) to me in age, and preferably in geography- I live in NW. 

Finally, I used to think this would go without saying, but since I've been proven wrong time and again... Yes, I enjoy sex. I am a human woman, not a slut, not a sex fiend. Women enjoy sex. I expect a partner who knows how to please me or is open to learning, and believes it is a mandatory part of a physical relationship. If you don't give as well as receive, keep moving. 

See physical details- if you are looking for a quiet little barbie, I'm not the woman for you. If you are looking for a real woman with real curves and real muscles from yoga, running, and spending time outdoors, who eats and laughs out loud and loves herself as she is, come and get me.

title: No ambiguity about it - Looking for a Friday night April 8th Date
text:
I am so sick of posting on all these online dating sites, only to get tons of guys who say they want to meet me (or send me winks/likes etc) but never actually email me. And then there are those who actually do email me but can't seem to take the next step and call me. But, let's not forget those guys who are ok talking on the phone or texting - but can't seem to actually ask me out! I don't understand what all that is about. 

The only reasonable explanation I can think of is because they are in another relationship (or courting someone for a new relationship) and not willing to be honest abut that, but too scared to give up another possibility. Does that ring true? 

And if so, how horrible that is. 

If you feel the same way that I do, and (big if here) IF you have Friday night free - lets talk about actually meeting in person for a date. 

I know it is scary for you guys. Because I might kidnap you at gunpoint and do horrible things to you!

But, I promise I won't. And I promise we will meet in a very public place because I too worry about those things happening to me. 

But - let's get to the important aspects - to see whether I am someone you might want to actually meet on Friday night - and vice versa. 

I am an educated, affectionate, young at heart, funny (hopefully that has come across in this posting just a bit?), down to earth, honest, and dependable SWF. I am also attractive (for my age), witty and can talk about almost anything - assuming I am paired with someone who also likes to talk. 

Also - I am a non-smoker, non drug user, social drinker and have no kids living at home. Looking for the same. 

I am not concerned about race - so black, white, pink or green - you are all welcome to reply, but if you are either of the later two - I'll require a picture to verify. 

I love most sports (won my bracket pool!!), the great outdoors, cooking, weekend getaways and live music and live theater. What about you?

Men I connect with are smart, easy to talk to, good sense of humor, and flirty. Extra points if you are taller than I, in good enough shape that you can see your toes when you look down, and have a great smile that you use often. Please be reasonably (plus or minus 10 years) close to my age and live in the DC area. 

Those who provide a lengthy reply providing as much information about yourself (at the bare minimum - age, race, height, body, location, interests, etc) will not be ignored. Those who send a canned reply that could be sent to any woman's post, will be ignored. 

To show me you read this entire ad, in your subject line, put where you want to meet on Friday, and the time. Ciao!

In my late 40s I finally found the courage to leave my job as a graphic designer and pursue my passion for food. It was part of a long maturing process that also involved creating a healthy distance between myself and my emotionally crippled family. My interest in nutrition soon led to an excitement about cooking and eventually to my becoming a health-oriented personal chef. My individuation from my family and their white-bread-and-mayonnaise values has led to the discovery of myself as a person who is willing to feel deeply, act boldly and think creatively. I want to be with a man who has also become his own person, who considers life an adventure and who has time for romance, intimacy and me.

In my work I help others cook better, host cooking/dinner parties, and cater dinner parties. I'm interested in exploring the science as well as practicing the art of cooking. It would be be great to be with someone who enjoys food and who likes to be the kitchen but I'm capable of being drawn into your world as well if you truly love what you do.

A good match for me is someone who . . ..

...wants to make a difference (big or small scale).
. . .is happy to take the scenic route to just about anywhere
. . .is charmed by down-in-the valley views just as much as bird's-eye vistas.
. . .wants to explore the world --cultures and history-- through food and people, cities and the countryside
....likes to be active, has all-day energy.


Religion has no appeal to me - but I'm definitely intrigued with "spirituality" (am using this for a lack of a better word). Meaning to say, I'm interested in understanding that what's there but cannot be seen.

Community involvement is important to me, I'm active with the South Bay sustainable food movement. Will soon start a two-year term as president of a nonprofit.

Friends? Family? Kids? I have several very close friends, and consider them my family. I raised 4 step children with ex husband in the 90s/early 00s.

Still have my full-suspension mtn bike, panniers, snorkel, backpack, sleeping bag, downhill ski equipment, X-country ski boots, snowshoes. ...and want to do all these activities with a partner,

Eventually, I want to golf, have really enjoyed it the couple of times I've played. And I want to play the piano again, and ride a horse again. I would love to be a good singer and hope to someday take lessons, bonus if I find someone who likes to sing (together). And I love to dance ... the waltz, tango, swing. I'm not one who needs perfection, just enjoyment in a shared activity.

title: Not all women are bad

The fact is some dudes have to do better.

The number 1 thing I hear guys say is, women only like bad boys. Followed by, "what does she look like?" So in one breathe you have someone calling a woman pretty much superficial because she looks for a certain attribute in a man and in another breathe you have that's same someone reducing a woman to a particular attribute. 
Newsflash, both sexes have good people and bad people. Both sexes can be superficial. But there are a lot of self proclaimed "nice" or "good" guys that actually aren't. Just because a woman doesn't want you doesn't mean its because she thinks you're a nice guy, you could simply suck. And no one wants to be with a sucky person. 
If you only want a woman for her looks you are not a nice guy. If you treat women badly because of the way women have treated you, you are not a good guy. And if you do something nice expecting something in return or some kind or recognition, you are selfish. Luckily that's not all men.

This morning I found myself wishing I had a semi regular brunch partner. Someone who I could wake up with, throw my leg over and tempt with brunch by talking about the bruleed grapefruit at Farmer Fisher Baker's. Ok, so I know a grapefruit probably wouldn't tempt any dude, but come on, it has fire scorched sugar on top, its heaven. Yes, they have some pretty good man food too. 

Sigh. Anyway. 

I am a nurse, I see more bad things than any one person should. For that reason, I don't nitpick or nag. Things that are just simply annoying, aren't worth the effort. I am reasonably sane. I can cook well, and I will likely make you a sandwich without being asked. I am a spoiler, probably even more when you don't deserve it. 

I find intelligence sexy, but have been known to have some real airheaded moments. 

I am an INFJ, if you are into that whole Myers Briggs thing. Its a pretty accurate portrayal of me too. I am not crippled by my introversion, but I definitely do not mind spending a Friday night at home, catching up on the one or two TV shows I watch each week. title: Jewish Survivor of Awkward Friends & Family Questions

Your mother reminds you that you arenÃ‚Â´t getting any younger, and why canÃ‚Â´t you be more like your brother\sister\cousin (thrice-removed) and settle down?
